markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs=""
>
[Scion of Domora Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4106) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Gatewalkers</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #188: They Watched the Stars](/Sources.aspx?ID=194) pg. 82</row>

**Archetype** [Scions of Domora](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=202)

**Prerequisites**
[Familiar Master Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1970)

</column>

---

You gain a spirit guide ally. Your familiar takes on the form of a [spirit guide](/Familiars.aspx?ID=23&Specific=true) specific familiar.

**Special** You can take Scion of Domora Dedication even if you have the Familiar Master Dedication and have not taken two other [Familiar Master](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=60) feats. You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained at least two other feats from the scion of Domora or familiar master archetypes.

<title level="2">Scion of Domora Dedication leads to...</title>
[Guardian's Embrace](/Feats.aspx?ID=4109), [Guided Skill](/Feats.aspx?ID=4108), [Invigorating Breath](/Feats.aspx?ID=4110), [Spirit Guide Form](/Feats.aspx?ID=4113), [Spiritual Aid](/Feats.aspx?ID=4112), [Spiritual Flurry](/Feats.aspx?ID=4111), [Spiritual Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=4107)
name: Scion of Domora Dedication
